p:
It is important to recognise, however, that our simulations rendered eutrophic regions insensitive to Fe fertilisation. Consequently, we neglect the response of Fe-limited regions like the Southern Ocean that not only have demonstrated potential for CO 2 drawdown
5– 7, 38, 45 , but also influence low latitude biogeochemistry through mode and intermediate waters
47 . This work should therefore not be interpreted as a globally integrated response to Fe fertilisation. Instead, it isolates the response of the lower latitudes and offers important lessons. First, that the debated
32, 48, 49 CO 2 drawdown via the tropics is possible. Second, that this drawdown can accompany and thus complement high latitude mechanisms of CO 2 drawdown. Third, that this drawdown requires simultaneous relief from both Fe and NO 3 limitation
14– 16 , which is plausibly achieved by stimulating N 2 fixers with dust-borne Fe.
